intro: Globulariopsis wittebergensis, commonly known as the Witteberg globularia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale blue blooms, which appear in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
